text: Trav'ling lady, stay awhile
Until the night is over.
I'm just a station on your way,
I know I'm not your lover.
Well I lived with a child of snow
When I was a soldier,
And I fought every man for her
Until the nights grew colder.
She used to wear her hair like you
Except when she was sleeping,
And then she'd weave it on a loom
Of smoke and gold and breathing.
And why are you so quiet now
Standing there in the doorway?
You chose your journey long before
You came upon this highway.
Traveling lady stay awhile
Until the night is over.
I'm just a station on your way,
I know I'm not your lover.

tokens.text: The station symbolism is used through LC's work; society rests, but never forever. She will meet some stranger, and be seduced into travelling a new route.
LC acknowledges that he's not the messiah

Snow represents ideas that are cold and crystalline, in contrast to the sea of faith, or the river of belief. To live in the snow is to have your social system be excluded from the temple, to exist only as facts, knowledge, and philosophy. A female child of snow would indicate some sort of social system that was born of exile, harsh necessity and reason.
